title: Homemade Cruffins

description: Indulge in the delightful combination of croissants and muffins with these homemade cruffins. Buttery, flaky, and filled with cinnamon-sugar goodness, they are a perfect treat for any occasion.
ingredients: 1 cup whole milk, warmed to about 110°F (43°C)
2 and 1/4 teaspoons instant or active dry yeast
3 tablespoons unsalted or salted butter, softened
3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed
1 cup salted butter, slightly softened for lamination
optional fillings: Nutella, jam, lemon curd, or pastry cream
instructions: Whisk the warm milk, yeast, and sugar together in a stand mixer bowl. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
Add butter, 2 cups of flour, and salt. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add remaining flour and beat on low until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough for 5 minutes until it is soft and slightly tacky. Perform the windowpane test to check readiness.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise for about 2 hours until nearly double in size.
Gently punch down the dough and flatten it into a 10x14-inch rectangle. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Prepare the lamination butter by beating it with 1 tablespoon of flour until combined.
Spread the butter on the center third of the dough and fold the edges over to enclose the butter. Roll out to a 9x12-inch rectangle and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Repeat the lamination process two more times, rolling and folding the dough, refrigerating in between.
Lightly grease a muffin pan. Mix sugar and cinnamon in a bowl.
Roll out the dough into an 8x12-inch rectangle, sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar, and cut into 12 strips.
Layer 3 strips together, roll them up, and place in the muffin pan. Repeat for all strips.
Cover the cruffins and let rise for 1 hour until puffy.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C). Bake for 25-28 minutes until golden and the internal temperature reaches 200°F (93°C).
Roll the cruffins in cinnamon-sugar and fill with your choice of filling if desired.
tips: Ensure your butter is at the right temperature for lamination to achieve flaky layers. Avoid adding too much flour while kneading to keep the dough soft.

structured_content.content: These homemade cruffins are a delightful treat that combines the best of both worlds: the flaky layers of croissants and the comforting shape of muffins. With a generous sprinkle of cinnamon-sugar, they are perfect for breakfast or a sweet snack.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 6 hours
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weekend brunch or special occasions
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Customizable with various fillings

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I tried a cruffin at a local bakery, and I was instantly hooked. The flaky texture and sweet filling made it a memorable experience, and now I can recreate that joy at home!

• Main ingredient: Whole milk is ideal for richness; warm it to activate the yeast.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Cinnamon adds warmth and sweetness; use fresh for the best flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter is crucial for the flaky layers; European-style butter works best.
  • Equipment needed: Stand mixer, muffin pan, rolling pin, and silicone baking mat are essential for best results.

Preparation:
Prepare the dough by mixing and allowing it to rise properly. Knead until soft and slightly tacky.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the lamination steps carefully to create flaky layers. Shape the cruffins and let them rise before baking.
Finishing Touches:
Roll in cinnamon-sugar and fill with your favorite fillings for a delightful finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Keep your butter at the right temperature for easy lamination.
  • Avoid overworking the dough to prevent a tough texture.
  • Look for a golden brown color and a hollow sound when tapping the bottom of the cruffins to know they're done.
  • Store leftovers at room temperature for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing these cruffins with friends and family brings joy and warmth to any gathering. They are a perfect way to show love through baking!
Experiment with different fillings like Nutella or lemon curd to elevate the flavor profile of your cruffins. You can also add nuts or dried fruits for extra texture.
Serve these cruffins warm with a side of fresh fruit or a cup of coffee for a delightful breakfast or brunch. They also make a great dessert paired with ice cream.
For a gluten-free option, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. You can also try vegan butter and non-dairy milk for a dairy-free version.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a thermometer to check the internal temperature for perfect doneness.
  • Let the dough rest if it becomes too elastic while rolling.
  • Keep your workspace floured to prevent sticking during lamination.
  • For a professional look, brush with an egg wash before baking for a glossy finish.
